intro: Coussapoa puberula, commonly known as the hairy coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
